summary: This is a letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys (Cohen & Gresser LLP) to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, making extensive requests for discovery and Brady material in the criminal case against Maxwell. The letter references prior government productions and seeks information on victims, witnesses, the 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement, and various investigative materials.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The client of the law firm Cohen & Gresser LLP, who is the subject of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The letter is a discovery request on her behalf.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Repeatedly referenced in relation to the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) he signed, alleged sexual abuse, and investigations. The discovery requests seek materials concerning him and his interactions with victims and attorneys.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Attorney at Cohen & Gresser LLP who signed the letter, representing Ghislaine Maxwell. He is making the discovery requests to the prosecution.

persons.name: Bradley Edwards
persons.context: Identified as one of the "Attorneys" representing victims in civil cases against Epstein and Maxwell. The letter requests communications between these attorneys and prosecutors.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Identified as one of the "Attorneys" representing victims. The letter requests communications involving him and other victim attorneys.

connections.description: Maxwell is charged in relation to Epstein's alleged sex trafficking scheme. The document references their association and joint investigations.
Everdell is writing the discovery request letter as an attorney representing Maxwell in her criminal case.
Edwards is an attorney who represented victims in civil cases against Epstein, as referenced in the discovery requests.
Edwards is an attorney for victims, and the defense seeks communications between him and prosecutors regarding investigations into Maxwell.
Both are attorneys at Cohen & Gresser LLP working on Maxwell's defense team, as indicated by the letter's signature and cc list.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Signs Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signed a Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) with federal prosecutors. The defense requests all communications concerning the negotiations of this agreement.

events.title: Attorneys Meet with SDNY Prosecutors
events.description: Attorneys for victims (including Bradley Edwards) met with SDNY prosecutors to request a criminal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. SDNY declined to pursue the case at that time.

events.title: SDNY Investigation Begins
events.description: The government asserts that the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell began in or about 2018.

events.title: Government Discovery Production
events.description: The government produced discovery materials to the defense.

events.title: Government Discovery Production
events.description: The government produced discovery materials to the defense, including statements from prior civil cases and emails about the NPA.

events.title: Government Discovery Production
events.description: The government produced discovery materials to the defense, including statements made at the time of arrest and seven pages of a diary.

events.title: Government Discovery Production
events.description: The government's most recent production of discovery materials, which the defense states it is still reviewing.

locations: New York, NY 10007 (United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza)
New York, NY 10022 (Cohen & Gresser LLP, 800 Third Avenue, 21st Floor)
Southern District of Florida (referenced as location of prior Epstein investigation and NPA)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team is aggressively seeking discovery, including all communications related to Jeffrey Epstein's 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA).
The defense requests the identities and complete birthdates of the individuals identified in the indictment as Minor Victims 1-3.
The letter reveals that victim attorneys, including Bradley Edwards, met with SDNY prosecutors in 2016 to push for a criminal investigation into Epstein and Maxwell, but SDNY declined at that time.
The defense seeks a wide range of materials on witnesses, including their diaries, travel records, school records, financial records, and communications with their attorneys.
The letter references specific evidence like a partially produced diary, an FBI 302 report, and drafts of a book/memoir titled "The Billionaires Playboy Club."
